p: The robustness of the final calibration model is evaluated from its ability to perform calibration and prediction. The calibration performance of the model is determined from the root mean square error of calibration (RMSEC) and the correlation coefficient (R C) in the calibration set. Meanwhile, the prediction performance of the model is identified from the root mean square error of prediction (RMSEP) and the correlation coefficient (R P) in the prediction set. Ideally, an effective model should register low RMSEC and RMSEP, with minimum difference between RMSEC and RMSEP. Not least, higher R C and R P are preferable [ 33, 34].
